content.div:
Being the international superstar of song, film and drugstore fragrance that she is, Beyonce is a busy lady. She's busy partying until 4 a.m. at Jay-Z's 40/40 club, she's busy trademarking her baby's name -- oh, she's probably busy keeping up with Blue Ivy Carter (and her nannies), too.

And with Billboard reporting that Bey is preparing to launch a new single -- "End of Time," the 4 album track you'd be most likely to pop your booty to -- the lady's more harried than ever. No wonder she's asking for help in the matter.

Beyonce wants you to remix "End of Time." Well, provided you have the necessary chops, that is. Having more social media clout than Bieber and Gaga combined couldn't hurt, either.

A remix contest was launched on the pop star's official website Wednesday -- along with all the necessary files you'll need to craft your version of a Beyonce hit -- and Team B will be looking at the 50 most popular submissions (as voted on by users of music sharing site Soundcloud) to select one winner.

The prize? $4,000 US -- significantly less than the price of Blue Ivy's Swarovski bedazzled baby tub, but at least it's a nice tie-in to the title of Bey's latest album. (That would be 4, by the way.)

Full contest details can be found at Beyonce's website -- along with several early remix submissions, in case you want to check out the competition.

For the rest of us, we'll just enjoy "End of Time," original recipe. Check out video of Beyonce performing the song below:

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: If only Jay-Z had quit using the word "bitch" before writing "99 Problems." No worries. We've got a few suggestions for re-writes.

link.Abstract: Beyonce and Jay-Z took Blue Ivy Carter home early Tuesday. Still, reports of new parents being affected by the pop stars' hospital security presence continue to surface.
link.title: Beyonce and Jay-Z Head For Home With Baby Blue As Hospital Brushes Off Reports of Neglected Patients

link.Abstract: Beyonce and Jay-Z welcomed their daughter Blue Ivy Carter at a New York hospital over the weekend, and according to reports, efforts to keep their special delivery as VIP as possible have inconvenienced other new parents at the medical facility.
link.title: Baby Blue Ivy Carter Gonna Run This Hospital Tonight; Beyonce and Jay-Z's Security Cause Trouble For Other New Parents

link.Abstract: Jay-Z released a song celebrating the birth of Blue Ivy Carter, and the new baby even "sings" on the track. Listen to "Glory" here.

link.Abstract: Those aren't her eyes, 'Ye. Kanye West, Jay-Z and Nicki Minaj performed at the 2011 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show, airing Nov. 29 on CBS. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Kanye West, Jay-Z and Nicki Minaj at the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal

link.Abstract: Jay-Z and Kanye West wrapped their Watch the Throne tour in Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18. For the final concert's closing number, they performed the single "N*ggas in Paris" 11 times. Crazy. In that spirit, here are 11 of the best photos from Vancouver. We invite you to spend approx. 40 minutes flipping through them.
link.title: The 11 Best Photos From Watch the Throne's Final Show

link.Abstract: Do babies like sweater capes? How about salt-water taffy? Oprah Winfrey would make an awesome godmother, but she's not Blue Ivy's.
